UI

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • UI.Button

  • public class Button
extends java.lang.Object
    Author: Shiera Buttons Can have either 1 or 2 images Button is a toggleButton if if has 2 images toggleOn/toggle of does nothing if there's only 1 image

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Button(BaseFrame frame, java.lang.String imageName, int posX, int posY, ButtonHandler handler)
      Constructor used to not toggleButtons
      Button(BaseFrame frame, java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String selectedImageName, int posX, int posY, ButtonHandler handler)
      Constructor used to toggleButton
      Button(BaseFrame frame, java.lang.String defaultImageName, java.lang.String selectedImageName, int posX, int posY, ButtonHandler handler, boolean toggle)
      Constructor used to toggleButton

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changePos(int posX, int posY)
      change the position of the button
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      draws the button at it's own coordinates
      boolean ifClicked(int clickPosX, int clickPosY)
      calls handler's onButtonClick if the clickPosition are inside of the button
      void toggleOf()
      toggles of the button does nothing if button has only 1 picture
      void toggleOn(Button... buttonsToToggleOf)
      toggles on the button, toggles off the buttons given as parameters changes the picture of the button does nothing if button has only 1 picture

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Button

        public Button(BaseFrame frame,
      java.lang.String defaultImageName,
      java.lang.String selectedImageName,
      int posX,
      int posY,
      ButtonHandler handler,
      boolean toggle)
        Constructor used to toggleButton
        Parameters:
        frame - the BaseFrame used in the game
        defaultImageName - name of the image, image should be in the package src/pictures/buttonPictures
        selectedImageName - name of image used when button is toggled, should be in same package as the other image
        posX - x-coordinate (pixels) of the upper left corner of the button
        posY - y-coordinate (pixels) of the upper left corner of the button
        handler - will be called when the button is clicked
        toggle - = should the button use the toggle method instead of toggleOn toggleOf, toggle is automatic if true

      • Button

      java.lang.String selectedImageName,
      int posX,

        frame - the BaseFrame used in the game
        imageName - name of the image, image should be in the package src/pictures/buttonPictures
        selectedImageName - name of image used when button is toggled, should be in same package as the other image
        posX - x-coordinate (pixels) of the upper left corner of the button
        posY - y-coordinate (pixels) of the upper left corner of the button
        handler - will be called when the button is clicked

    • Method Detail

      • changePos

        public void changePos(int posX,
             int posY)
        change the position of the button
        Parameters:
        posX - new x-coordinate (pixels) of the button
        posY - new y-coordinate (pixels) of the button

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        draws the button at it's own coordinates
        Parameters:
        g2 - Graphics2D needed

      • toggleOn

        public void toggleOn(Button... buttonsToToggleOf)
        toggles on the button, toggles off the buttons given as parameters changes the picture of the button does nothing if button has only 1 picture
        Parameters:
        buttonsToToggleOf - 0 .. * buttons to toggle of

      • toggleOf

        public void toggleOf()
        toggles of the button does nothing if button has only 1 picture

      • ifClicked

        public boolean ifClicked(int clickPosX,
                int clickPosY)
        calls handler's onButtonClick if the clickPosition are inside of the button
        Parameters:
        clickPosX - x-coordinate (pixels) of the click
        clickPosY - y-coordinate (pixels) of the click
